alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Henry; Owen (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 19 at 8:25PM EST until February 22 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kentucky... Kentucky River at Lockport Lock affecting Owen, Henry and Carroll Counties. .Heavy rain from Wednesday night and Thursday will cause the river to rise. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Kentucky River at Lockport Lock. * WHEN...Until early Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 30.0 feet, Parts of Eagle Creek campground, between Worthville and Perry, flood along KY 355. At 33.0 feet, Low lying roads near the river along and west of KY 355 flood. At 36.0 feet, Low areas of Point of Rock and Old Landing Roads, and low lying roads near Perry Park flood in Monterey. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM EST Sunday the stage was 32.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tonight to a crest of 34.0 feet early Tuesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Tuesday evening. - Flood stage is 33.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 34.5 feet on 02/13/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are affected by these crests take any necessary actions. Additional information is available at water.weather.gov/ahps2/index. php?wfo=lmk Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio and your local media for the latest information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lmk. The next statement will be issued Monday morning.
